   20: 
   21: -module(time_SUITE).
   22: -compile({nowarn_deprecated_function, {erlang,now,0}}).
   23: 
   24: %% "Time is on my side." -- The Rolling Stones
   25: 
   26: %% Tests the BIFs:
   27: %%	erlang:localtime_to_universaltime/1
   28: %%	erlang:universaltime_to_localtime/1
   29: %%	date/0
   30: %%	time/0
   31: %%	now/0
   32: %%
   33: 
   34: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   35: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, univ_to_local/1, local_to_univ/1,
   36: 	 bad_univ_to_local/1, bad_local_to_univ/1,
   37: 	 univ_to_seconds/1, seconds_to_univ/1,
   38: 	 consistency/1,
   39: 	 now_unique/1, now_update/1, timestamp/1,
   40: 	 time_warp_modes/1,
   41: 	 monotonic_time_monotonicity/1,
   42: 	 monotonic_time_monotonicity_parallel/1,
   43: 	 time_unit_conversion/1,
   44: 	 signed_time_unit_conversion/1,
   45: 	 erlang_timestamp/1,
   46:          native_time_unit_gh6165/1]).
   47: 
   48: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   49: 
   50: -export([local_to_univ_utc/1]).
   51: 
   52: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   53: 
   54: -export([linear_time/1]).
   55: 
   56: %% The following defines the timezone in which the test is run.
   57: %% It is interpreted as the number of hours to be added to UTC
   58: %% to obtain the local time.  The number will be positive east
   59: %% of Greenwhich, negative west of Greenwhich.
   60: %%
   61: %% Allowable range is -12 through 11.
   62: 
   63: -define(timezone, 1).
   64: 
   65: %% Similarly to timezone, but the difference when Daylight Saving Time
   66: %% is in use.  [Same range.]
   67: 
   68: -define(dst_timezone, 2).
   69: 
   70: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
   71:     [{testcase, Func}|Config].
   72: 
   73: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
   74:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   75: 
   76: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   77: 
   78: all() -> 
   79:     [univ_to_local, local_to_univ, local_to_univ_utc,
   80:      bad_univ_to_local, bad_local_to_univ, 
   81:      univ_to_seconds, seconds_to_univ,
   82:      consistency,
   83:      {group, now}, timestamp,
   84:      time_warp_modes,
   85:      monotonic_time_monotonicity,
   86:      monotonic_time_monotonicity_parallel,
   87:      time_unit_conversion,
   88:      signed_time_unit_conversion,
   89:      erlang_timestamp,
   90:      native_time_unit_gh6165].
   91: 
   92: groups() -> 
   93:     [{now, [], [now_unique, now_update]}].
   94: 
   95: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   96:     Config.
   97: 
   98: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   99:     ok.
  100: 
  101: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  102:     Config.
  103: 
  104: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  105:     Config.
  106: 
  107: 
  108: %% Test that DST = true on timezones without DST is ignored
  109: local_to_univ_utc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  110:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-env", "TZ", "UTC"]),
  111:     {{2008,8,1},{0,0,0}} =
  112:         rpc:call(Node,
  113:                  erlang,localtime_to_universaltime,
  114:                  [{{2008, 8, 1}, {0, 0, 0}},
  115:                   false]),
  116:     {{2008,8,1},{0,0,0}} =
  117:         rpc:call(Node,
  118:                  erlang,localtime_to_universaltime,
  119:                  [{{2008, 8, 1}, {0, 0, 0}},
  120:                   true]),
  121:     [{{2008,8,1},{0,0,0}}] =
  122:         rpc:call(Node,
  123:                  calendar,local_time_to_universal_time_dst,
  124:                  [{{2008, 8, 1}, {0, 0, 0}}]),
  125:     peer:stop(Peer).
  126: 
  127: 
  128: %% Tests conversion from universal to local time.
  129: %% These cases are currently implemented only for MET and fail in
  130: %%  all other timezones
  131: is_stockholm_time() ->
  132:     case os:type() of
  133:         {win32, _} -> case os:cmd("tzutil /g") of
  134:                           "W. Europe Standard Time"++_ -> true;
  135:                           _ -> false
  136:                       end;
  137:         {unix, _} -> case os:cmd("date '+%Z'") of
  138:                           "ME"++_ -> true; %% covers MET/MEST
  139:                           "CE"++_ -> true; %% covers CET/CEST
  140:                           _ -> false
  141:                       end
  142:     end.
  143: 
  144: univ_to_local(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  145:     case is_stockholm_time() of
  146:         true -> test_univ_to_local(test_data());
  147:         false -> {skip, "This test is only valid for Stockholm timezone"}
  148:     end.
  149: 
  150: test_univ_to_local([{Utc, Local}|Rest]) ->
  151:     io:format("Testing ~p => ~p~n", [Local, Utc]),
  152:     Local = erlang:universaltime_to_localtime(Utc),
  153:     test_univ_to_local(Rest);
  154: test_univ_to_local([]) ->
  155:     ok.
  156: 
  157: %% Tests conversion from local to universal time.
  158: 
  159: local_to_univ(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  160:     case is_stockholm_time() of
  161:         true -> test_local_to_univ(test_data());
  162:         false -> {skip, "This test is only valid for Stockholm timezone"}
  163:     end.
  164: 
  165: test_local_to_univ([{Utc, Local}|Rest]) ->
  166:     io:format("Testing ~p => ~p~n", [Utc, Local]),
  167:     Utc = erlang:localtime_to_universaltime(Local),
  168:     test_local_to_univ(Rest);
  169: test_local_to_univ([]) ->
  170:     ok.
  171: 
  172: %% Test bad arguments to erlang:universaltime_to_localtime; should
  173: %% generate a badarg.
  174: 
  175: bad_univ_to_local(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  176:     bad_test_univ_to_local(bad_dates()).
  177: 
  178: bad_test_univ_to_local([Utc|Rest]) ->
  179:     io:format("Testing ~p~n", [Utc]),
  180:     case catch erlang:universaltime_to_localtime(Utc) of
  181: 	      {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} -> bad_test_univ_to_local(Rest)
  182: 	  end;
  183: bad_test_univ_to_local([]) ->
  184:     ok.
  185: 
  186: %% Test bad arguments to erlang:localtime_to_universaltime/1; should
  187: %% generate a badarg.
  188: 
  189: bad_local_to_univ(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  190:     bad_test_local_to_univ(bad_dates()).
  191: 
  192: bad_test_local_to_univ([Local|Rest]) ->
  193:     io:format("Testing ~p~n", [Local]),
  194:     case catch erlang:localtime_to_universaltime(Local) of
  195: 	      {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} -> bad_test_local_to_univ(Rest)
  196: 	  end;
  197: bad_test_local_to_univ([]) ->
  198:     ok.
  199: 
  200: 
  201: %% Test universaltime to seconds conversions
  202: univ_to_seconds(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  203:     test_univ_to_seconds(ok_utc_seconds()).
  204: 
  205: test_univ_to_seconds([{Datetime, Seconds}|DSs]) ->
  206:     io:format("universaltime = ~p -> seconds = ~p", [Datetime, Seconds]),
  207:     Seconds = erlang:universaltime_to_posixtime(Datetime),
  208:     test_univ_to_seconds(DSs);
  209: test_univ_to_seconds([]) -> 
  210:     ok.
  211: 
  212: %% Test seconds to universaltime conversions
  213: seconds_to_univ(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  214:     test_seconds_to_univ(ok_utc_seconds()).
  215: 
  216: test_seconds_to_univ([{Datetime, Seconds}|DSs]) ->
  217:     io:format("universaltime = ~p <- seconds = ~p", [Datetime, Seconds]),
  218:     Datetime = erlang:posixtime_to_universaltime(Seconds),
  219:     test_seconds_to_univ(DSs);
  220: test_seconds_to_univ([]) -> 
  221:     ok.
  222: 
  223: 
  224: %% Test that the the different time functions return
  225: %% consistent results.
  226: consistency(_Config) ->
  227:     %% Test that:
  228:     %% 	 * date() & time() gives the same time as erlang:localtime()
  229:     %%
  230:     %%   * the difference between erlang:universaltime() and
  231:     %%     erlang:localtime() is reasonable (with assuming any
  232:     %%     particular timezone)
  233: 
  234:     ok = compare_date_time_and_localtime(16),
  235:     compare_local_and_universal(16).
  236: 
  237: compare_date_time_and_localtime(Times) when Times > 0 ->
  238:     {Year, Mon, Day} = date(),
  239:     {Hour, Min, Sec} = time(),
  240:     case erlang:localtime() of
  241: 	{{Year, Mon, Day}, {Hour, Min, Sec}} -> ok;
  242: 	_ -> compare_date_time_and_localtime(Times-1)
  243:     end;
  244: compare_date_time_and_localtime(0) ->
  245:     error.
  246: 
  247: compare_local_and_universal(Times) when Times > 0 ->
  248:     Utc = erlang:universaltime(),
  249:     Local = erlang:localtime(),
  250:     io:format("local = ~p, utc = ~p", [Local,Utc]),
  251: 
  252:     AcceptableDiff = 14*3600,
  253:     case linear_time(Utc) - linear_time(Local) of
  254: 	Diff when abs(Diff) < AcceptableDiff ->
  255: 	    ok;
  256: 	Diff ->
  257: 	    io:format("More than ~p seconds difference between "
  258: 		      "local and universal time", [Diff]),
  259: 	    ct:fail(huge_diff)
  260:     end.
  261: 
  262: %% This function converts a date and time to a linear time.
  263: %% Two linear times can be subtracted to give their difference
  264: %% in seconds.
  265: %%
  266: %% XXX Limitations: Simplified leap year calc will fail for 2100 :-)
  267: 
  268: linear_time({{Year, Mon, Day}, {Hour, Min, Sec}}) ->
  269:     86400*(year_to_days(Year) + month_to_days(Year,Mon) + (Day-1)) +
  270: 	3600*Hour + 60*Min + Sec.
  271: 
  272: year_to_days(Year) ->
  273:     Year * 365 + (Year-1) div 4.
  274: 
  275: month_to_days(Year, Mon) ->
  276:     DoM = [31,days_in_february(Year),31,30,31,30,31,31,30,31,30,31],
  277:     {PastMonths,_} = lists:split(Mon-1, DoM),
  278:     lists:sum(PastMonths).
  279: 
  280: days_in_february(Year) ->
  281:     case (Year rem 4) of
  282: 	0 -> 29;
  283: 	_ -> 28
  284:     end.
  285: 
  286: %% Test (the bif) os:timestamp/0, which is something quite like, but not
  287: %% similar to erlang:now...
  288: 
  289: %% Test that os:timestamp works.
  290: timestamp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  291:     try
  292: 	repeating_timestamp_check(100000)
  293:     catch
  294: 	throw : {fail, Failure} ->
  295: 	    %%
  296: 	    %% Our time warping test machines currently warps
  297: 	    %% time every 6:th second. If we get a warp during
  298: 	    %% 10 seconds, assume this is a time warping test
  299: 	    %% and ignore the failure.
  300: 	    %%
  301: 	    case had_time_warp(10) of
  302: 		true ->
  303: 		    {skip, "Seems to be time warp test run..."};
  304: 		false ->
  305: 		    ct:fail(Failure)
  306: 	    end
  307:     end.
  308: 
  309: os_system_time_offset() ->
  310:     erlang:convert_time_unit(os:system_time() - erlang:monotonic_time(),
  311: 			     native, microsecond).
  312: 
  313: had_time_warp(Secs) ->
  314:     had_time_warp(os_system_time_offset(), Secs).
  315: 
  316: had_time_warp(_OrigOffs, 0) ->
  317:     false;
  318: had_time_warp(OrigOffs, N) ->
  319:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  320:     case OrigOffs - os_system_time_offset() of
  321: 	Diff when Diff > 500000; Diff < -500000 ->
  322: 	    true;
  323: 	_Diff ->
  324: 	    had_time_warp(OrigOffs, N-1)
  325:     end.
  326: 
  327: repeating_timestamp_check(0) ->
  328:     ok;
  329: repeating_timestamp_check(N) ->
  330:     {A,B,C} = TS = os:timestamp(),
  331:     if
  332: 	is_integer(A),
  333: 	is_integer(B),
  334: 	is_integer(C),
  335: 	B < 1000000,
  336: 	C < 1000000 ->
  337: 	    ok;
  338: 	true ->
  339: 	    ct:fail("Strange return from os:timestamp/0 ~w~n",[TS])
  340:     end,
  341:     %% I assume the now and timestamp should not differ more than 1 hour,
  342:     %% which is safe assuming the system has not had a large time-warp
  343:     %% during the testrun...
  344:     Secs = A*1000000+B+round(C/1000000),
  345:     {NA,NB,NC} = erlang:now(),
  346:     NSecs = NA*1000000+NB+round(NC/1000000),
  347:     case Secs - NSecs of
  348: 	TooLarge when TooLarge > 3600 ->
  349: 	    throw({fail,
  350: 	       lists:flatten(
  351: 		io_lib:format("os:timestamp/0 is ~w s more than erlang:now/0",
  352: 			     [TooLarge]))});
  353: 	TooSmall when TooSmall < -3600 ->
  354: 	    throw({fail,
  355: 	      lists:flatten(
  356: 		io_lib:format("os:timestamp/0 is ~w s less than erlang:now/0",
  357: 			     [-TooSmall]))});
  358: 	_ ->
  359: 	    ok
  360:     end,
  361:     repeating_timestamp_check(N-1).
  362: 	    
  363: 
  364: %% Test now/0.
  365: 
  366: 
  367: %% Tests that successive calls to now/0 returns different values.
  368: %% Also returns a comment string with the median difference between
  369: %% times (in microseconds).
  370: 
  371: now_unique(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  372:     now_unique(1000, now(), []),
  373:     fast_now_unique(100000, now()).
  374: 
  375: now_unique(N, Previous, Result) when N > 0 ->
  376:     case now() of
  377: 	      Previous ->
  378: 		  ct:fail("now/0 returned the same value twice");
  379: 	      New ->
  380: 		  now_unique(N-1, New, [New|Result])
  381: 	  end;
  382: now_unique(0, _, [Then|Rest]) ->
  383:     now_calc_increment(Rest, microsecs(Then), []).
  384: 
  385: now_calc_increment([Then|Rest], Previous, _Result) ->
  386:     This = microsecs(Then),
  387:     now_calc_increment(Rest, This, [Previous-This]);
  388: now_calc_increment([], _, Differences) ->
  389:     {comment, "Median increment: " ++ integer_to_list(median(Differences))}.
  390: 
  391: fast_now_unique(0, _) -> ok;
  392: fast_now_unique(N, Then) ->
  393:     case now() of
  394: 	Then ->
  395: 	    ct:fail("now/0 returned the same value twice");
  396: 	Now ->
  397: 	    fast_now_unique(N-1, Now)
  398:     end.
  399: 
  400: median(Unsorted_List) ->
  401:     Length = length(Unsorted_List),
  402:     List = lists:sort(Unsorted_List),
  403:     case Length rem 2 of
  404: 	0 ->					% Even length.
  405: 	    [A, B] = lists:nthtail((Length div 2)-1, List),
  406: 	    (A+B)/2;
  407: 	1 ->					% Odd list length.
  408: 	    lists:nth((Length div 2)+1, List)
  409:     end.
  410: 
  411: microsecs({Mega_Secs, Secs, Microsecs}) ->
  412:     (Mega_Secs*1000000+Secs)*1000000+Microsecs.
  413: 
  414: %% Test that the time differences returned by two calls to
  415: %% now/0 one second apart is comparable to the difference of two
  416: %% calls to erlang:localtime().
  417: 
  418: now_update(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  419:     case test_server:is_debug() of
  420: 	false -> now_update1(10);
  421: 	true -> {skip,"Unreliable in DEBUG build"}
  422:     end.
  423: 
  424: 
  425: now_update1(N) when N > 0 ->
  426:     T1_linear = linear_time(erlang:localtime()),
  427:     T1_now = microsecs(now()),
  428: 
  429:     receive after 1008 -> ok end,
  430: 
  431:     T2_linear = linear_time(erlang:localtime()),
  432:     T2_now = microsecs(now()),
  433: 
  434:     Linear_Diff = (T2_linear-T1_linear)*1000000,
  435:     Now_Diff = T2_now-T1_now,
  436:     io:format("Localtime diff = ~p; now() diff = ~p", [Linear_Diff, Now_Diff]),
  437:     case abs(Linear_Diff - Now_Diff) of
  438: 	      Abs_Delta when Abs_Delta =< 40000 -> ok;
  439: 	      _ -> now_update1(N-1)
  440: 	  end;
  441: now_update1(0) ->
  442:     ct:fail("now_update zero").
  443: 
  444: time_warp_modes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  445:     %% All time warp modes always supported in
  446:     %% combination with no time correction...
  447:     check_time_warp_mode(false, no_time_warp),
  448:     check_time_warp_mode(false, single_time_warp),
  449:     check_time_warp_mode(false, multi_time_warp),
  450: 
  451:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  452:     try
  453: 	case erts_debug:get_internal_state({check_time_config,
  454: 					    true, no_time_warp}) of
  455: 	    false -> ok;
  456: 	    true -> check_time_warp_mode(true, no_time_warp)
  457: 	end,
  458: 	case erts_debug:get_internal_state({check_time_config,
  459: 					    true, single_time_warp}) of
  460: 	    false -> ok;
  461: 	    true -> check_time_warp_mode(true, single_time_warp)
  462: 	end,
  463: 	case erts_debug:get_internal_state({check_time_config,
  464: 					    true, multi_time_warp}) of
  465: 	    false -> ok;
  466: 	    true -> check_time_warp_mode(true, multi_time_warp)
  467: 	end
  468:     after
  469: 	erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false)
  470:     end.
  471: 
  472: check_time_warp_mode(TimeCorrection, TimeWarpMode) ->
  473:     io:format("~n~n~n***** Testing TimeCorrection=~p TimeWarpMode=~p *****~n",
  474: 	      [TimeCorrection, TimeWarpMode]),
  475:     Mon = erlang:monitor(time_offset, clock_service),
  476:     _ = erlang:time_offset(),
  477:     Start = erlang:monotonic_time(1000),
  478:     MonotonicityTimeout = 2000,
  479:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+c", atom_to_list(TimeCorrection), "+C", atom_to_list(TimeWarpMode)]),
  480:     StartTime = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [start_time]),
  481:     Me = self(),
  482:     MonotincityTestStarted = make_ref(),
  483:     MonotincityTestDone = make_ref(),
  484:     spawn_link(Node,
  485: 	       fun () ->
  486: 		       Me ! MonotincityTestStarted,
  487: 		       cmp_times(erlang:start_timer(MonotonicityTimeout,
  488: 						    self(),
  489: 						    timeout),
  490: 				 erlang:monotonic_time()),
  491: 		       Me ! MonotincityTestDone
  492: 	       end),
  493:     receive MonotincityTestStarted -> ok end,
  494:     check_time_offset(Node, TimeWarpMode),
  495:     TimeWarpMode = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [time_warp_mode]),
  496:     TimeCorrection = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [time_correction]),
  497:     receive MonotincityTestDone -> ok end,
  498:     MonotonicTime = rpc:call(Node, erlang, monotonic_time, []),
  499:     MonotonicTimeUnit = rpc:call(Node,
  500: 				       erlang,
  501: 				       convert_time_unit,
  502: 				       [1, second, native]),
  503:     UpMilliSeconds = erlang:convert_time_unit(MonotonicTime - StartTime,
  504: 					      MonotonicTimeUnit,
  505: 					      millisecond),
  506:     io:format("UpMilliSeconds=~p~n", [UpMilliSeconds]),
  507:     End = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  508:     peer:stop(Peer),
  509:     try
  510: 	true = (UpMilliSeconds > (98*MonotonicityTimeout) div 100),
  511: 	true = (UpMilliSeconds < (102*(End-Start)) div 100)
  512:     catch
  513: 	error:_ ->
  514: 	    io:format("Uptime inconsistency", []),
  515: 	    case {TimeCorrection, erlang:system_info(time_correction)} of
  516: 		{true, true} ->
  517: 		    ct:fail(uptime_inconsistency);
  518: 		{true, false} ->
  519: 		    _ = erlang:time_offset(),
  520: 		    receive
  521: 			{'CHANGE', Mon, time_offset, clock_service, _} ->
  522: 			    ignore
  523: 		    after 1000 ->
  524: 			    ct:fail(uptime_inconsistency)
  525: 		    end;
  526: 		_ ->
  527: 		    ignore
  528: 	    end
  529:     end,
  530:     erlang:demonitor(Mon, [flush]),
  531:     ok.
  532: 
  533: check_time_offset(Node, no_time_warp) ->
  534:     final = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [time_offset]),
  535:     final = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_flag, [time_offset, finalize]),
  536:     final = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [time_offset]);
  537: check_time_offset(Node, single_time_warp) ->
  538:     preliminary = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [time_offset]),
  539:     preliminary = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_flag, [time_offset, finalize]),
  540:     final = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [time_offset]),
  541:     final = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_flag, [time_offset, finalize]);
  542: check_time_offset(Node, multi_time_warp) ->
  543:     volatile = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [time_offset]),
  544:     volatile = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_flag, [time_offset, finalize]),
  545:     volatile = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [time_offset]).
  546: 
  547: monotonic_time_monotonicity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  548:     Done = erlang:start_timer(10000,self(),timeout),
  549:     cmp_times(Done, erlang:monotonic_time()).
  550: 
  551: cmp_times(Done, X0) ->
  552:     X1 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  553:     X2 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  554:     X3 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  555:     X4 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  556:     X5 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  557:     true = (X0 =< X1),
  558:     true = (X1 =< X2),
  559:     true = (X2 =< X3),
  560:     true = (X3 =< X4),
  561:     true = (X4 =< X5),
  562:     receive
  563: 	{timeout, Done, timeout} ->
  564: 	    ok
  565:     after 0 ->
  566: 	    cmp_times(Done, X5)
  567:     end.
  568: 
  569: -define(NR_OF_MONOTONIC_CALLS, 100000).
  570: 
  571: monotonic_time_monotonicity_parallel(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  572:     Me = self(),
  573:     Result = make_ref(),
  574:     Go = make_ref(),
  575:     UpAndRunning = make_ref(),
  576:     NoOnlnScheds = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
  577:     OffsetUI = erlang:unique_integer([monotonic]),
  578:     OffsetMT = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  579:     MinHSz = ?NR_OF_MONOTONIC_CALLS*(2
  580: 				     + 3
  581: 				     + erts_debug:flat_size(OffsetUI)
  582: 				     + erts_debug:flat_size(OffsetMT)),
  583:     Ps = lists:map(
  584: 	   fun (Sched) ->
  585: 		   spawn_opt(
  586: 		     fun () ->
  587: 			     Me ! {self(), UpAndRunning},
  588: 			     receive Go -> ok end,
  589: 			     Res = fetch_monotonic(?NR_OF_MONOTONIC_CALLS, []),
  590: 			     Me ! {self(), Result, Sched, Res}
  591: 		     end,
  592: 		     [{scheduler, Sched},
  593: 		      {priority, max},
  594: 		      {min_heap_size, MinHSz}])
  595: 	   end,
  596: 	   lists:seq(1, NoOnlnScheds)),
  597:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> receive {P, UpAndRunning} -> ok end end, Ps),
  598:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> P ! Go end, Ps),
  599:     TMs = recv_monotonics(Result, OffsetMT, OffsetUI, NoOnlnScheds, []),
  600:     true = check_monotonic_result(TMs, OffsetMT, OffsetUI, true).
  601: 
  602: check_monotonic_result([{_Sched, _PrevUI, _MT, _PostUI}],
  603: 		       _OffsetMT, _OffsetUI, Res) ->
  604:     Res;
  605: check_monotonic_result([{_ASched, _APrevUI, AMT, APostUI} = A,
  606: 			{_BSched, BPrevUI, BMT, _BPostUI} = B | _] = L,
  607: 		       OffsetMT, OffsetUI, Res) ->
  608:     NewRes = case (AMT =< BMT) orelse (BPrevUI < APostUI) of
  609: 		 true ->
  610: 		     Res;
  611: 		 false ->
  612: 		     io:format("INCONSISTENCY: ~p ~p~n", [A, B]),
  613: 		     false
  614: 	     end,
  615:     check_monotonic_result(tl(L), OffsetMT, OffsetUI, NewRes).
  616: 
  617: recv_monotonics(_Result, _OffsetMT, _OffsetUI, 0, Acc) ->
  618:     lists:keysort(2, Acc);
  619: recv_monotonics(Result, OffsetMT, OffsetUI, N, Acc) ->
  620:     receive
  621: 	{_, Result, Sched, Res} ->
  622: 	    CRes = convert_monotonic(Sched, OffsetMT, OffsetUI, Res, []),
  623: 	    recv_monotonics(Result, OffsetMT, OffsetUI, N-1, CRes ++ Acc)
  624:     end.
  625: 
  626: convert_monotonic(_Sched, _OffsetMT, _OffsetUI, [{_MT, _UI}], Acc) ->
  627:     Acc;
  628: convert_monotonic(Sched, OffsetMT, OffsetUI,
  629: 		  [{MT, UI}, {_PrevMT, PrevUI} | _] = L, Acc) ->
  630:     convert_monotonic(Sched, OffsetMT, OffsetUI, tl(L),
  631: 		      [{Sched, PrevUI-OffsetUI, MT-OffsetMT, UI-OffsetUI}
  632: 		       | Acc]).
  633: 
  634: fetch_monotonic(0, Acc) ->
  635:     Acc;
  636: fetch_monotonic(N, Acc) ->
  637:     MT = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  638:     UI = erlang:unique_integer([monotonic]),
  639:     fetch_monotonic(N-1, [{MT, UI} | Acc]).
  640: 
  641: -define(CHK_RES_CONVS_TIMEOUT, 400).
  642: 
  643: time_unit_conversion(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  644:     Mon = erlang:monitor(time_offset, clock_service),
  645:     start_check_res_convs(Mon, 1000000000000),
  646:     start_check_res_convs(Mon, 2333333333333),
  647:     start_check_res_convs(Mon, 5732678356789),
  648:     erlang:demonitor(Mon, [flush]).
  649:     
  650: start_check_res_convs(Mon, Res) ->
  651:     io:format("Checking ~p time_unit~n", [Res]),
  652:     check_res_convs(Mon,
  653: 		    erlang:start_timer(?CHK_RES_CONVS_TIMEOUT,
  654: 				       self(),
  655: 				       timeout),
  656: 		    Res).
  657:     
  658: 
  659: check_res_convs(Mon, Done, Res) ->
  660:     receive
  661: 	{timeout, Done, timeout} ->
  662: 	    case Res div 10 of
  663: 		0 ->
  664: 		    ok;
  665: 		NewRes ->
  666: 		    start_check_res_convs(Mon, NewRes)
  667: 	    end
  668:     after 0 ->
  669: 	    do_check_res_convs(Mon, Done, Res)
  670:     end.
  671: 
  672: do_check_res_convs(Mon, Done, Res) ->
  673:     TStart = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  674:     T = erlang:monotonic_time(Res),
  675:     TEnd = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  676:     TMin = erlang:convert_time_unit(TStart, native, Res),
  677:     TMax = erlang:convert_time_unit(TEnd, native, Res),
  678:     %io:format("~p =< ~p =< ~p~n", [TMin, T, TEnd]),
  679:     true = (TMin =< T),
  680:     true = (TMax >= T),
  681:     check_time_offset_res_conv(Mon, Res),
  682:     check_res_convs(Mon, Done, Res).
  683: 
  684: 
  685: check_time_offset_res_conv(Mon, Res) ->
  686:     TORes = erlang:time_offset(Res),
  687:     TO = erlang:time_offset(),
  688:     case erlang:convert_time_unit(TO, native, Res) of
  689: 	TORes ->
  690: 	    ok;
  691: 	TORes2 ->
  692: 	    case check_time_offset_change(Mon, TO, 1000) of
  693: 		{TO, false} ->
  694: 		    ct:fail({time_unit_conversion_inconsistency,
  695: 			     TO, TORes, TORes2});
  696: 		{_NewTO, true} ->
  697: 		    io:format("time_offset changed", []),
  698: 		    check_time_offset_res_conv(Mon, Res)
  699: 	    end
  700:     end.
  701: 
  702: signed_time_unit_conversion(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  703:     chk_strc(1000000000, 1000000),
  704:     chk_strc(1000000000, 1000),
  705:     chk_strc(1000000000, 1),
  706:     chk_strc(1000000, 1000),
  707:     chk_strc(1000000, 1),
  708:     chk_strc(1000, 1),
  709:     chk_strc(4711, 17),
  710:     chk_strc(1 bsl 10, 1),
  711:     chk_strc(1 bsl 16, 10),
  712:     chk_strc(1 bsl 17, 1 bsl 8),
  713:     chk_strc((1 bsl 17) + 1, (1 bsl 8) - 1),
  714:     chk_strc(1 bsl 17, 11),
  715:     ok.
  716: 
  717: chk_strc(Res0, Res1) ->
  718:     case (Res0 /= Res1) andalso (Res0 =< 1000000) andalso (Res1 =< 1000000) of
  719: 	true ->
  720: 	    {FromRes, ToRes} = case Res0 > Res1 of
  721: 				   true -> {Res0, Res1};
  722: 				   false -> {Res1, Res0}
  723: 			       end,
  724: 	    MinFromValuesPerToValue = FromRes div ToRes,
  725: 	    MaxFromValuesPerToValue = ((FromRes-1) div ToRes)+1,
  726: 	    io:format("~p -> ~p [~p, ~p]~n",
  727: 		      [FromRes, ToRes,
  728: 		       MinFromValuesPerToValue, MaxFromValuesPerToValue]),
  729: 	    chk_values_per_value(FromRes, ToRes,
  730: 				 -10*FromRes, 10*FromRes,
  731: 				 MinFromValuesPerToValue,
  732: 				 MaxFromValuesPerToValue,
  733: 				 undefined, MinFromValuesPerToValue);
  734: 	_ ->
  735: 	    ok
  736:     end,
  737:     chk_random_values(Res0, Res1),
  738:     chk_random_values(Res1, Res0),
  739:     ok.
  740: 
  741: chk_random_values(FR, TR) ->
  742:     io:format("rand values ~p -> ~p~n", [FR, TR]),
  743:     rand:seed(exsplus, {268438039,268440479,268439161}),
  744:     Values = lists:map(fun (_) -> rand:uniform(1 bsl 65) - (1 bsl 64) end,
  745: 		       lists:seq(1, 100000)),
  746:     CheckFun = fun (V) ->
  747:                        CV = erlang:convert_time_unit(V, FR, TR),
  748:                        case {(FR*CV) div TR =< V,
  749:                              (FR*(CV+1)) div TR >= V} of
  750:                            {true, true} ->
  751:                                ok;
  752:                            Failure ->
  753:                                ct:fail({Failure, CV, V, FR, TR})
  754:                        end
  755:                end,
  756:     lists:foreach(CheckFun, Values).
  757: 		       
  758: 
  759: chk_values_per_value(_FromRes, _ToRes,
  760: 	 EndValue, EndValue,
  761: 	 MinFromValuesPerToValue, MaxFromValuesPerToValue,
  762: 	 _ToValue, FromValueCount) ->
  763: %    io:format("~p [~p]~n", [EndValue, FromValueCount]),
  764:     case ((MinFromValuesPerToValue =< FromValueCount)
  765: 	  andalso (FromValueCount =< MaxFromValuesPerToValue)) of
  766: 	false ->
  767: 	    ct:fail({MinFromValuesPerToValue,
  768: 		     FromValueCount,
  769: 		     MaxFromValuesPerToValue});
  770: 	true ->
  771: 	    ok
  772:     end;
  773: chk_values_per_value(FromRes, ToRes, Value, EndValue,
  774: 		     MinFromValuesPerToValue, MaxFromValuesPerToValue,
  775: 		     ToValue, FromValueCount) ->
  776:     case erlang:convert_time_unit(Value, FromRes, ToRes) of
  777:         ToValue ->
  778:             chk_values_per_value(FromRes, ToRes,
  779:                                  Value+1, EndValue,
  780:                                  MinFromValuesPerToValue,
  781:                                  MaxFromValuesPerToValue,
  782:                                  ToValue, FromValueCount+1);
  783:         NewToValue ->
  784:             case ((MinFromValuesPerToValue =< FromValueCount)
  785:                   andalso (FromValueCount =< MaxFromValuesPerToValue)) of
  786:                 false ->
  787:                     ct:fail({MinFromValuesPerToValue,
  788:                              FromValueCount,
  789:                              MaxFromValuesPerToValue});
  790:                 true ->
  791:                     %		    io:format("~p -> ~p [~p]~n",
  792:                     %			      [Value, NewToValue, FromValueCount]),
  793:                     chk_values_per_value(FromRes, ToRes,
  794:                                          Value+1, EndValue,
  795:                                          MinFromValuesPerToValue,
  796:                                          MaxFromValuesPerToValue,
  797:                                          NewToValue, 1)
  798:             end
  799:     end.
  800: 
  801: erlang_timestamp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  802:     Mon = erlang:monitor(time_offset, clock_service),
  803:     {TO, _} = check_time_offset_change(Mon,
  804: 				       erlang:time_offset(),
  805: 				       0),
  806:     Done = erlang:start_timer(10000,self(),timeout),
  807:     ok = check_erlang_timestamp(Done, Mon, TO).
  808: 
  809: check_erlang_timestamp(Done, Mon, TO) ->
  810:     receive
  811:         {timeout, Done, timeout} ->
  812:             erlang:demonitor(Mon, [flush]),
  813:             ok
  814:     after 0 ->
  815:               do_check_erlang_timestamp(Done, Mon, TO)
  816:     end.
  817: 
  818: do_check_erlang_timestamp(Done, Mon, TO) ->
  819:     MinMon = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  820:     {MegaSec, Sec, MicroSec} = erlang:timestamp(),
  821:     MaxMon = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  822:     TsMin = erlang:convert_time_unit(MinMon+TO,
  823: 				     native,
  824: 				     microsecond),
  825:     TsMax = erlang:convert_time_unit(MaxMon+TO,
  826: 				     native,
  827: 				     microsecond),
  828:     TsTime = (MegaSec*1000000+Sec)*1000000+MicroSec,
  829:     case (TsMin =< TsTime) andalso (TsTime =< TsMax) of
  830: 	true ->
  831: 	    NewTO = case erlang:time_offset() of
  832: 			TO ->
  833: 			    TO;
  834: 			_ ->
  835: 			    check_time_offset_change(Mon, TO, 0)
  836: 		    end,
  837: 	    check_erlang_timestamp(Done, Mon, NewTO);
  838: 	false ->
  839: 	    io:format("TsMin=~p TsTime=~p TsMax=~p~n", [TsMin, TsTime, TsMax]),
  840: 	    io:format("Detected inconsistency; "
  841: 		      "checking for time_offset change...", []),
  842: 	    case check_time_offset_change(Mon, TO, 1000) of
  843: 		{TO, false} ->
  844: 		    ct:fail(timestamp_inconsistency);
  845: 		{NewTO, true} ->
  846: 		    io:format("time_offset changed", []),
  847: 		    check_erlang_timestamp(Done, Mon, NewTO)
  848: 	    end
  849:     end.
  850: 
  851: check_time_offset_change(Mon, TO, Wait) ->
  852:     process_changed_time_offset(Mon, TO, false, Wait).
  853: 
  854: process_changed_time_offset(Mon, TO, Changed, Wait) ->
  855:     receive
  856: 	{'CHANGE', Mon, time_offset, clock_service, NewTO} ->
  857: 	    process_changed_time_offset(Mon, NewTO, true, Wait)
  858:     after Wait ->
  859: 	    case erlang:time_offset() of
  860: 		TO ->
  861: 		    {TO, Changed};
  862: 		_OtherTO ->
  863: 		    receive
  864: 			{'CHANGE', Mon, time_offset, clock_service, NewTO} ->
  865: 			    process_changed_time_offset(Mon, NewTO, true, Wait)
  866: 		    end
  867: 	    end
  868:     end.
  869:     
  870: 
  871: native_time_unit_gh6165(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  872:     %% This test could potentially fail even when no bug exists if
  873:     %% run during heavy load, or if OS system time or Erlang system time
  874:     %% is changed at an unfortunate time, but it is hard to make the test
  875:     %% more stable than this without losing actual testing...
  876: 
  877:     ChkDiff = fun (Val) ->
  878:                       case erlang:convert_time_unit(Val, native, nanosecond) of
  879:                           Ns when -1000000 < Ns andalso Ns < 1000000 ->
  880:                               erlang:display({diff, Ns}),
  881:                               ok;
  882:                           Ns ->
  883:                               erlang:display({large_diff, Ns}),
  884:                               ct:fail({large_diff, Ns})
  885:                       end
  886:               end,
  887:     
  888:     process_flag(priority, max),
  889: 
  890:     erlang:yield(),
  891:     V1 = erlang:monotonic_time(native) - erlang:monotonic_time(),
  892:     ChkDiff(V1),
  893: 
  894:     erlang:yield(),
  895:     V2 = erlang:system_time(native) - erlang:system_time(),
  896:     ChkDiff(V2),
  897: 
  898:     erlang:yield(),
  899:     V3 = os:system_time(native) - os:system_time(),
  900:     ChkDiff(V3),
  901:     
  902:     erlang:yield(),
  903:     0 = erlang:time_offset() - erlang:time_offset(native),
  904: 
  905:     ok.
  906: 
  907: %% Returns the test data: a list of {Utc, Local} tuples.
  908: 
  909: test_data() ->
  910:     {TZ,DSTTZ} = 
  911: 	case os:type() of
  912: 	    {unix,_} ->
  913: 		case os:cmd("date '+%Z'") of
  914: 		    "SAST"++_ ->
  915: 			{2,2};
  916:                     "PDT"++_ ->
  917:                         {-8,-7};
  918:                     "PST"++_ ->
  919:                         {-8,-7};
  920:                     "UTC"++_ ->
  921:                         {0,0};
  922: 		    _ ->
  923: 			{?timezone,?dst_timezone}
  924: 		end;
  925: 	    _ ->
  926: 		{?timezone,?dst_timezone}
  927: 	end,
  928:     test_data(nondst_dates(), TZ) ++
  929: 	test_data(dst_dates(), DSTTZ) ++
  930: 	crossover_test_data(crossover_dates(), TZ).    
  931: 
  932: 
  933: %% test_data1() ->
  934: %%     test_data(nondst_dates(), ?timezone) ++
  935: %% 	test_data(dst_dates(), ?dst_timezone) ++
  936: %% 	crossover_test_data(crossover_dates(), ?timezone).
  937: 
  938: crossover_test_data([{Year, Month, Day}|Rest], TimeZone) when TimeZone > 0 ->
  939:     Hour = 23,
  940:     Min = 35,
  941:     Sec = 55,
  942:     Utc = {{Year, Month, Day}, {Hour, Min, Sec}},
  943:     Local = {{Year, Month, Day+1}, {Hour+TimeZone-24, Min, Sec}},
  944:     [{Utc, Local}|crossover_test_data(Rest, TimeZone)];
  945: crossover_test_data([{Year, Month, Day}|Rest], TimeZone) when TimeZone < 0 ->
  946:     Hour = 0,
  947:     Min = 23,
  948:     Sec = 12,
  949:     Utc = {{Year, Month, Day}, {Hour, Min, Sec}},
  950:     Local = {{Year, Month, Day-1}, {Hour+TimeZone+24, Min, Sec}},
  951:     [{Utc, Local}|crossover_test_data(Rest, TimeZone)];
  952: crossover_test_data([], _) ->
  953:     [].
  954: 
  955: test_data([Date|Rest], TimeZone) ->
  956:     Hour = 12,
  957:     Min = 45,
  958:     Sec = 7,
  959:     Utc = {Date, {Hour, Min, Sec}},
  960:     Local = {Date, {Hour+TimeZone, Min, Sec}},
  961:     [{Utc, Local}|test_data(Rest, TimeZone)];
  962: test_data([], _) ->
  963:     [].
  964:     
  965: nondst_dates() ->
  966:     [{1996, 01, 30},
  967:      {1997, 01, 30},
  968:      {1998, 01, 30},
  969:      {1999, 01, 30},
  970:      {1996, 02, 29},
  971:      {1997, 02, 28},
  972:      {1998, 02, 28},
  973:      {1999, 02, 28},
  974:      {1996, 03, 2},
  975:      {1997, 03, 2},
  976:      {1998, 03, 2},
  977:      {1999, 03, 2}].
  978: 
  979: dst_dates() ->
  980:     [{1996, 06, 1},
  981:      {1997, 06, 2},
  982:      {1998, 06, 3},
  983:      {1999, 06, 4}].
  984: 
  985: %% exakt utc {date(), time()} which corresponds to the same seconds since 1 jan 1970 
  986: %% negative seconds are ok
  987: %% generated with date --date='1979-05-28 12:30:35 UTC' +%s
  988: ok_utc_seconds() -> [
  989: 	{ {{1970, 1, 1},{ 0, 0, 0}},            0 },
  990: 	{ {{1970, 1, 1},{ 0, 0, 1}},            1 },
  991: 	{ {{1969,12,31},{23,59,59}},           -1 },
  992: 	{ {{1920,12,31},{23,59,59}},  -1546300801 },
  993: 	{ {{1600,02,19},{15,14,08}}, -11671807552 },
  994: 	{ {{1979,05,28},{12,30,35}},    296742635 },
  995: 	{ {{1999,12,31},{23,59,59}},    946684799 },
  996: 	{ {{2000, 1, 1},{ 0, 0, 0}},    946684800 },
  997: 	{ {{2000, 1, 1},{ 0, 0, 1}},    946684801 },
  998: 
  999: 	{ {{2038, 1,19},{03,14,07}},   2147483647 }, % Sint32 full - 1
 1000: 	{ {{2038, 1,19},{03,14,08}},   2147483648 }, % Sint32 full
 1001: 	{ {{2038, 1,19},{03,14,09}},   2147483649 }, % Sint32 full + 1
 1002: 
 1003: 	{ {{2106, 2, 7},{ 6,28,14}},   4294967294 }, % Uint32 full  0xFFFFFFFF - 1
 1004: 	{ {{2106, 2, 7},{ 6,28,15}},   4294967295 }, % Uint32 full  0xFFFFFFFF
 1005: 	{ {{2106, 2, 7},{ 6,28,16}},   4294967296 }, % Uint32 full  0xFFFFFFFF + 1
 1006: 	{ {{2012,12, 6},{16,28,08}},   1354811288 },
 1007: 	{ {{2412,12, 6},{16,28,08}},  13977592088 }
 1008:     ].
 1009: 
 1010: 
 1011: %% The following dates should not be near the end or beginning of
 1012: %% a month, because they will be used to test when the dates are
 1013: %% different in UTC and local time.
 1014: 
 1015: crossover_dates() ->
 1016:     [{1996, 01, 25},
 1017:      {1997, 01, 25},
 1018:      {1998, 01, 25},
 1019:      {1999, 01, 25},
 1020:      {1996, 02, 27},
 1021:      {1997, 02, 27},
 1022:      {1998, 02, 27},
 1023:      {1999, 02, 27}].
 1024: 
 1025: bad_dates() ->
 1026:     [{{1900, 7, 1}, {12, 0, 0}},		% Year
 1027: 
 1028:      {{1996, 0, 20}, {12, 0, 0}},		% Month
 1029:      {{1996, 13, 20}, {12, 0, 0}},
 1030: 
 1031:      {{1996, 1, 0}, {12, 0, 0}},		% Date
 1032:      {{1996, 1, 32}, {12, 0, 0}},
 1033:      {{1996, 2, 30}, {12, 0, 0}},
 1034:      {{1997, 2, 29}, {12, 0, 0}},
 1035:      {{1998, 2, 29}, {12, 0, 0}},
 1036:      {{1999, 2, 29}, {12, 0, 0}},
 1037:      {{1996, 4, 31}, {12, 0, 0}},
 1038:
